section.title: The status menu
section.p: The status menu is in the upper left corner of the , next to the Server ID menu. From the status menu, you can view the status of the server. You can also view the status of your high availability and cluster configuration.

The state of the server changes which actions are available in the :
When the server is in maintenance mode, you cannot use any monitoring actions.
When the server is stopped, you can use only a limited number of configuration actions.
When the server is restarting, you cannot use any actions until the server is started.
When the server is in a highly available configuration, and is the secondary node, you can use only a limited number of configuration actions. You must make configuration changes with the primary node server. For more information about the different server states, and how to change between the states, see , and .

section.title: The user menu
section.p:
The user menu is in the upper right corner of the . The icon for this menu is your user name. From the user menu, you can complete the following tasks:
Change your password
Logout

section.title: The help menu
section.p:
The help menu is in the upper right corner of the . The icon for this menu is a question mark in a circle. From the help menu, you can complete the following tasks:
Access the product help by clicking Help
Restore the common configuration and customization tasks to the home page by clicking Restore Tasks on Home Page
View the software license agreement by clicking About and then Show Software License Agreement
